attributes.action: Take Immediate Action To Prevent The Further Spread of Covid-19
attributes.additional_details:
In under two weeks, Italy has gone from 3 cases to...
3,089 cases
1,346 hospitalised (44%)
295 intensive care (9.6%)
107 dead (3.5%)
This is what it’s taken for the Italians to finally close all schools. We should not have to get to that level before we do the same. The NHS will have been terribly burdened (40% hospitalisation), infection will have spread and people will have died for nothing. The schools will have to close anyway. Early intervention saves lives and costs less in the long run.
attributes.background:
Immediately close all UK places of worship and schools to cut the number of potential transmission chains for Covid-19. 

Establish special high infection monitoring schools for the children of healthcare and other essential workers who cannot get childcare cover.
